name: Mission to Mars 2049
title: Board Game startup
description: In 2015, Skurbe launched the board game startup Mission to Mars 2049, achieving international distribution in six languages. During this time, he raised funding through crowdfunding and venture capital, pitching to Baltic, Scandinavian, and British investors via Seed Forum and the Latvian Business Angels Network. As the sole founder, he was responsible for game design, publishing, exhibition participation, distributor relations, logistics, Amazon sales in the UK and Germany, web and video design, as well as online marketing and customer support.

name: ¼ Satori
title: Web Portal Startup
description: ¼ Satori is an independent Latvian web portal focused on literature, philosophy, and culture. Launched by Dagnis Skurbe in the early 2000s, it began as a grassroots platform that he designed, edited, and maintained. It became one of Latvia's leading cultural media projects, later passed on to new editorial management.

name: Dinamo Rīga
title: Ice Hockey Club
description: Dinamo Rīga is Latvia’s most prominent professional ice hockey club, competing in the KHL. In 2008, Dagnis Skurbe developed the club's visual identity for its relaunch, including the logo, jersey, and digital presence. The iconic design incorporated historical elements and remained in use until 2020.

name: Liepājas Basketbols
title: Basketball Club
description: Liepājas Basketbols is a professional basketball club based in Liepāja, Latvia’s third-largest city. The club's branding, logo, and jerseys were designed by Dagnis Skurbe in 2018, incorporating regional symbolism such as the lion from the city’s coat of arms and its nickname — the 'windy city.'

name: CashKiosk
title: Quick Loans
description: CashKiosk is a quick loan provider based in Ukraine. In 2021, Dagnis Skurbe was responsible for crafting its visual identity, including logo and graphic design assets, as part of a branding project aimed at presenting a modern, accessible image to its target market.

name: Pablo
title: Quick Loans
description: Pablo is a Ukraine-based financial service offering quick loans via mobile apps. Dagnis Skurbe created the app’s identity, logo, and UI design in 2021. The visual language was enhanced by outsourced illustrations, aligning with a younger, digitally-native audience.

name: SponsorKing
title: Sponsoring Agency
description: SponsorKing is a Latvia-based agency focused on sponsorship and brand partnership solutions. In 2013, Dagnis Skurbe developed the agency’s complete brand identity, including its visual language and supporting materials.

name: made arhitekti
title: architecture office
description: MADE arhitekti is an award-winning architecture firm in Riga, Latvia, known for minimalistic and sustainable design. The logo created by Dagnis Skurbe in 2006 is still in use today — a rare case of a visual identity that has endured unchanged for nearly two decades.

name: Zelta Zivtiņa — logo refresh
title: Mobile Prepaid Card
description: Zelta Zivtiņa is Latvia’s largest prepaid mobile card service. In 2005, Dagnis Skurbe contributed to refreshing its logo and developing a new branding concept while working at DDB Latvia, modernizing the look of a widely recognized telecommunications product.

name: Yearbook.com
title: Automated College Yearbooks
description: Yearbook.com (also known as Yearbook Machine) is a London-based startup that automates the creation of printed yearbooks. Dagnis Skurbe joined the team as an in-house designer between 2011 and 2012, contributing to design and editorial layout during the company’s early scaling phase.

name: Reformu Partija
title: Political Party
description: Reformu Partija (The Reform Party) was a centrist political party in Latvia that won the 2011 parliamentary elections. It was founded by former president Valdis Zatlers. Dagnis Skurbe created the party’s logo and brandbook, helping shape its visual identity during a time of significant public attention and media scrutiny.

name: open name
title: open - what it is
description: Open is an online platform offering thought-provoking courses and lectures led by notable Latvian thinkers and academics. It focuses on making high-quality, in-depth knowledge accessible to a broad audience. Dagnis Skurbe contributed design and branding work for the initiative’s early communication materials.

name: makslai name
title: makslai - what it is
description: Mākslai vajag telpu ('Art Needs Space') is a cultural initiative advocating for the creation of a contemporary art museum in Latvia. It has hosted exhibitions and public campaigns to raise awareness. Dagnis Skurbe worked on design tasks supporting its message and visual identity in the early stages of the movement.

name: 5G Techritory
title: 5G Tech Conference
description: 5G Techritory is one of Europe’s leading conferences dedicated to 5G technology and innovation. Held in Riga, Latvia, it brings together top industry experts and policymakers. In 2018, Dagnis Skurbe collaborated with a small design team to develop the event’s visual identity and communication materials over a six-month period.

name: Binders
title: Road Construction
description: Binders is one of the largest construction and infrastructure development companies in Latvia, focusing on road building and civil engineering. Dagnis Skurbe created the company's visual identity in 2014, including its logo and core brand assets, to better reflect its scale and professionalism.

name: summer name
title: summer - what it is
description: Summer Sound is a large-scale music festival held annually in Liepāja, Latvia. Known for its seaside venue and diverse lineup, it attracts thousands of visitors each year. Dagnis Skurbe contributed branding and design elements to strengthen its visual presence and festival experience.

name: positivus name
title: positivus - what it is
description: Positivus is the biggest open-air music and arts festival in the Baltic States, attracting international acts and audiences. It has become a cultural touchstone for the region. Dagnis Skurbe worked on design and identity materials for the festival, helping to evolve its brand language during a pivotal stage of its growth.

name: Haemogram
title: A medical & tech startup
description: Haemogram was a medical & tech startup for blood analysis and monitoring targeted at sportsmen and athletes. Dagnis Skurbe worked on design and identity materials for the startup.

name: Api Connect
title: Tech Company
description: Api Connect (apiconn.com) is a tech company offering API-based communication tools and backend integration services. Though international in reach, it has Latvian ties. Dagnis Skurbe developed its logo and core brand identity in 2014 to help communicate its technical credibility and modern ethos.

name: BB Wakepark
title: Wakeboarding Park in Liepāja, Latvia
description: BB Wakepark is a wakeboarding park near Liepāja, Latvia. It serves as a summer destination for water sports and leisure activities. Dagnis Skurbe created the park’s visual identity, capturing both the adrenaline-driven nature of the sport and the relaxed coastal vibe of its location.

name: Royal Fitness
title: Gym in Liepāja, Latvia
description: Royal Fitness is a gym in Liepāja, Latvia. It serves as a summer destination for water sports and leisure activities. Dagnis Skurbe created the park’s visual identity, capturing both the adrenaline-driven nature of the sport and the relaxed coastal vibe of its location.

name: Sporta Izglītības Aģentūra
title: Sports Education Agency
description: Sporta Izglītības Aģentūra is an agency dedicated to sports education in Latvia, particularly focused on developing future coaches and sports professionals. Dagnis Skurbe created the visual identity, reflecting both educational integrity and athletic dynamism.

name: SportaCentrs.com
title: Latvia’s Largest Sports News Portal
description: SportaCentrs.com is Latvia’s leading sports news portal and associated TV channel, offering comprehensive coverage of local and international events. In 2009, Dagnis Skurbe designed the site’s logo and a series of themed interface skins used across affiliated platforms.

name: Latvija var!
title: Nationwide Civic Engagement Campaign
description: Latvija var! ('Latvia can!') is a national initiative aimed at motivating civic participation and belief in Latvia’s potential. The campaign included media outreach and social storytelling. Dagnis Skurbe worked on the campaign’s brand and messaging visuals.

name: LAPAS — Latvijas Platforma Attīstības Sadarbībai
title: Latvian Platform for Development Cooperation
description: LAPAS unites NGOs and institutions in Latvia working on sustainable development, democracy, and global responsibility. Dagnis Skurbe contributed design work to help the organization better communicate its mission and values to diverse audiences.

name: Latvija Basketball NT logo
title: Logo proposal for the Latvian national basketball team
description: A competition entry for the Latvian national basketball team logo.

name: Rīgas Stradiņa Universitāte (RSU)
title: Medical and Social Sciences University
description: Rīga Stradiņš University is one of the top medical and health sciences institutions in the Baltics also offering courses in other fields. Dagnis Skurbe worked as a lecturer giving a three month 8 hours a week course on UX/UI and product design to students of the International Business and Start-up Entrepreneurship program.

name: Ļoti Saistošs Ievads
title: Oxford Book Series by Satori.lv
work: Series Identity, Cover Designs, Book Layouts
description: “Ļoti saistošs ievads” is the Latvian edition of Oxford University Press’s acclaimed 'Very Short Introductions' series, published by Satori.lv. The series includes concise, accessible introductions to complex subjects like philosophy, ethics, and antisemitism. Dagnis Skurbe designed the visual identity and layout for the series, helping shape its distinct academic-yet-inviting aesthetic.

name: Maritec
title: Logo design for a construction company
description: Logo for a construction company from Latvia for its international business in the Scandinavian region. The project was cut short due to the company's business decisions.

name: Creative Andrejsala
title: Business & Culture Incubator in Riga
description: Creative Andrejsala was a multidisciplinary creative incubator located in the Andrejsala district of Riga, active from around 2006 to the late 2010s. It brought together artists, designers, startups, and cultural events in a post-industrial space by the port. The hub played a key role in shaping Latvia’s independent creative scene before large-scale redevelopment began in the area. Dagnis Skurbe designed the logo, website and identity for the incubator.

name: Survival Kit 2
title: Contemporary Art Festival
description: Survival Kit 2 was the second edition of the contemporary art festival organized by the Latvian Centre for Contemporary Art. It took place in Riga’s empty urban spaces and explored themes of social survival. Dagnis Skurbe was chosen as the main artist for the 2nd festival’s visual identity, combining bold graphic language with contextual relevance.

name: Give Us Work Riga
title: Creative Studio
description: Give Us Work was a Riga-based independent creative studio co-founded by Dagnis Skurbe. The studio focused on experimental design, advertising, and visual communication, operating with a sharp conceptual edge in both commercial and cultural projects.

name: Useless Stickers
title: Design Microbrand
description: Useless Stickers is an experimental side project and design microbrand exploring the absurd and ironic through stickers, prints, and digital art. The brand reflects Dagnis Skurbe’s wit and minimalist visual commentary on contemporary digital culture.

name: Kiki Cafe
title: Pop-up Summer Café
description: Kiki Cafe was a pop-up summer café in Riga, Latvia, offering a unique dining experience with a focus on fresh, locally sourced ingredients and a relaxed atmosphere. The café was designed to be a temporary space for people to gather and enjoy a meal. Dagnis Skurbe created the visual identity and concept designs, balancing laid-back summer aesthetics with a playful, youthful energy.

name: Andrejs Žagars — EP Campaign
title: European Parliament Campaign
description: Andrejs Žagars, the late cultural figure and opera director, was a candidate for the 2014 European Parliament elections under the 'Latvijas Attīstībai' party. Dagnis Skurbe helped shape the campaign’s visual narrative and materials, combining political messaging with refined cultural aesthetics.

name: Andrejs Žagars — EP Campaign
title: European Parliament Campaign
description: Andrejs Žagars, the late cultural figure and opera director, was a candidate for the 2014 European Parliament elections under the 'Latvijas Attīstībai' party. Dagnis Skurbe helped shape the campaign’s visual narrative and materials, combining political messaging with refined cultural aesthetics.

name: KHL Proposals
title: gagarin - what it is
description: gagarin description

name: CSKA Moscow
title: Ice Hockey Club
description: In 2009 I joined forces with the then Dinamo Rīga marketing director to pitch for a new identity creation of CSKA Moscow KHL hockey club. Even though some of the sketches got approved, the logo didn't get all the way through to the general management of the club.

name: KHL logo proposals
title: Ice Hockey Club
description: atlant description
